title: YAMAHA Vocaloid v.4 FE 4.2.0 [deepstatus]
description:
YAMAHA Vocaloid v.4 FE 4.2.0

The new engine allows the importation of Vocaloid 2 and Vocaloid 3 vocals, though Vocaloid 2 vocals must have already been imported into Vocaloid 3 for this to work. The new engine includes other features, but not all of them are accessible by Vocaloid 2 and Vocaloid 3 vocals. One of the new features is a "Growl" feature which allows vocals built for Vocaloid 4 to take on a growl-like property in their singing results. Cross-synthesis was also added, allowing the user to switch between two of a character's vocals built for the same language smoothly using a time-varying parameter. This feature is accessible by Vocaloid 3 and Vocaloid 4 vocals, but not Vocaloid 2. Another feature included is Pitch Rendering, which all imported vocals can use. This displays the effective pitch curve on the user interface. Finally, real-time input has been included in this version and is another feature which all vocals can use. VSQX files made for Vocaloid 3 work in Vocaloid 4

changes comparing to previous (4.1.0) version:
Enabling/Disabling the Phoneme Protect Settings
Show the extra user dictionary information
Listing a Job Plugin as a "Job" Menu Item
Selection History and the Swap Buttons for Control Parameters
Turning the User Dictionary off
Combining three or more parts of VOCALOID Tracks
Sorting the VOCALOID Tracks by dragging the mouse
Import/Export of My Singers setting
General improvements to stability

*supported language interfaces: english, japanese, korean, spanish, chinese, italian, french, russian, portuguese(Brasil), tagalog (philipino), vietnamese, Indonesian, malaysian, thai.

*over 100 job-plugins from Vocaloidstore and some user-made plugins, you can find them in VocaloidJob Plugins folder after installation

- Windows OS : Windows 8.1, Windows 8, Windows 7(32/64bit)

- CPU: Intel Dual Core CPU

- RAM: 2 GB and more

don't forget to read readme.txt for other information
you have to get voices separately, this is the software only, you can search for voices via audioz or via other resources
